bibl.title: Caesar or God (Mark 12: 13-17)? A Study in Formgeschichte.
bibl.note: Makes important use of: H.I. Bell and T.C. Skeat, Fragments of an Unknown Gospel and Other Early Christian Papyri (London, 1935), 43-59 (P. Egerton 2 = van Haelst 586): "it is conceivable that the British Museum papyrus represents a pre-Marcan account of the episode".
bibl.seg: Rist Martin, Caesar or God (Mark 12: 13-17)? A Study in Formgeschichte.

Makes important use of: H.I. Bell and T.C. Skeat, Fragments of an Unknown Gospel and Other Early Christian Papyri (London, 1935), 43-59 (P. Egerton 2 = van Haelst 586): "it is conceivable that the British Museum papyrus represents a pre-Marcan account of the episode".
